intro: Ichnanthus leiocarpus, commonly known as the slender false pennywort, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes willows and evening primroses. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its flowers are small, white, and clustered in loose racemes, and it produces small, round fruits. The leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture, contributing to its ornamental value in wetland gardens.
